value.name: QueryString
value.summary: Allows requests when the URL contains a ? (query string)

value.name: FragmentIdentifiers
value.summary: Allows requests when the URL contains a # (fragment identifier)

value.name: DotDot
value.summary: Allows requests when the URL contains a .. (dotdot)

value.name: CmdExe
value.summary: Allows requests when the URL contains cmd.exe

value.name: cp1250
value.summary: Windows Central European and Eastern European

value.name: iso8859_1
value.summary: ISO-8859-1 Latin 1 including Albanian, Catalan, Danish, Dutch, English, Finnish, French, German, Italian, Norwegian, Portuguese, Spanish, and Swedish

value.name: iso8859_2
value.summary: ISO-8859-2 including Bosnian, Croatian, Czech, Hungarian, Polish, Romanian, Slovakian, and Slovenian

value.name: iso8859_4
value.summary: ISO-8859-4 including Estonian, Greenlandic, Latvian, Lithuanian, and Sami

value.name: iso8859_5
value.summary: ISO-8859-5 including Belarusian, Bulgarian, Kazakh, Macedonian, Russian, Serbian, Turkish, and Ukrainian

object.name: AS2ProxySourceProtocolHandler

property.name: mAdminState
property.label: Enable administrative state
property.summary: Set the administrative state of this configuration.
property.hoverhelp: <p>Set the administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set the check box.</li><li>To make inactive, clear the check box.</li></ul>
property.description: <p>The administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set to enabled.</li><li>To make inactive, set to disabled.</li></ul>
A descriptive summary for the configuration.
property.summary: Enter a descriptive summary for the configuration.
property.name: UserSummary
LocalAddress
property.label: IP address
property.summary: Enter the IP address or host alias on which the service listens.
property.hoverhelp: Enter the IP address or host alias to listen on for incoming HTTP traffic. The default value indicates that the service listens on all IP addresses.
property.description: Specifies the address to listen on for incoming HTTP traffic. The default value indicates that the service listens on all IP addresses.

property.name: LocalPort
property.summary: The local TCP port number that supports server operations
property.hoverhelp: Enter the port to listen on for incoming HTTP traffic. Enter a value in the range of 1 - 65535. The default value is 80.
property.description: Specifies the port to listen on for incoming HTTP traffic. Enter a value in the range 1 - 65535. The default value is 80.

property.name: HTTPVersion
property.summary: HTTP version for client side connections
property.description: Select the HTTP version for client side connections. The default value is HTTP 1.1.

property.name: AllowedFeatures
property.summary: Methods and versions to allow for incoming requests
property.description: Specifies the methods and versions to allow for incoming HTTP requests.

property.name: PersistentConnections
property.summary: Whether to negotiate persistent connections on front side
property.description: Indicates whether to negotiate persistent connections where appropriate on front side. The default is enabled.

property.name: MaxPersistentConnectionsReuse
property.summary: The maximum number of times a persistent connection is reused on the front side
property.description: Specifies the maximum number of times a persistent connection is reused on the front side. When the maximum reuse count is reached, an explicit <tt>HTTP Connection: close</tt> header is sent in the response and the TCP connection is closed. The default value is 0, which means unlimited reuse.

property.name: AllowCompression
property.summary: Indicate whether to negotiate GZIP compression for client side connections.
property.description: <p>Whether to negotiate GZIP compression for client side connections.</p><p>The default is off. If enabled, the DataPower service uses GZIP to compress HTTP transmissions when the <tt>Accept-Encoding</tt> HTTP header indicates that compressed documents can be processed.</p><p>The <tt>Transfer-Encoding</tt> HTTP header indicates compression.</p>

property.name: MaxURLLen
property.summary: The length of the longest incoming URL to accept
property.description: Specifies the length of the longest incoming URL to accept. The length includes any query string or fragment identifier. Enter a value in the range 1 - 128000. The default value is 16384.

property.name: MaxTotalHdrLen
property.summary: Maximum aggregate length of incoming HTTP headers to allow
property.description: Specifies the maximum aggregate length of incoming HTTP headers to allow. Enter a value in the range 5 - 128000. The default value is 128000.

property.name: MaxHdrCount
property.summary: Maximum number of headers to allow in HTTP requests
property.description: Specifies the maximum number of headers to allow in the incoming request messages. The default value is 0, which indicates no limit.

property.name: MaxNameHdrLen
property.summary: Maximum length of the name part of an HTTP header
property.description: Specifies the maximum length of HTTP header names. Each HTTP header is expressed as a name-value pair. This setting specifies the maximum length of the name portion for HTTP headers. The default value is 0, which indicates no limit.

property.name: MaxValueHdrLen
property.summary: Maximum length of the value part of an HTTP header
property.description: Specifies the maximum length of HTTP header values to allow. Each HTTP header is expressed as a name-value pair. This setting specifies the maximum length of the value portion of that header. The default value is 0, which indicates no limit.

property.name: MaxQueryStringLen
property.summary: Maximum length of the HTTP query string to allow
property.description: The portion of the URL after the question mark (?) is known as the query string. This property specifies its maximum length in bytes. The default value is 0, which indicates no limit.

Specifies the access control list to allow or deny access to this service based on the IP address of the client. When attached to a service, an access control list denies all access by default. To deny access to only selected addresses, first grant access to all addresses (allow 0.0.0.0) and then create deny entries for the desired hosts.
property.summary: The access control list to allow or deny access to this service
property.name: ACL

property.description: Specifies the character encoding of the original basic authentication values. Basic authentication credentials are combined and base64 encoded in the authorization header of the request. The DataPower Gateway transcodes the contents of the authorization header to UTF-8. The default value is Protocol, which represents ISO-8859-1, Latin 1.
property.summary: Character encoding of the original basic authentication values
property.name: CredentialCharset
SSLProxy
property.label: TLS proxy profile
property.summary: The TLS proxy profile is deprecated. Use a TLS server profile or TLS SNI server profile.
property.description: Specifies a TLS proxy profile for securing the communication between the requesting client and the DataPower Gateway.

property.name: RemoteAddress
property.summary: IP address, host name, or load balancer group name of the Multi-Enterprise Integration Gateway server.
property.description: Specifies the IP address, host name, or name of a load balancer group of the Multi-Enterprise Integration Gateway server.

property.name: RemotePort
property.summary: Destination port on the Multi-Enterprise Integration Gateway server.
property.description: Specifies the destination port on the Multi-Enterprise Integration Gateway server.

property.name: RemoteSSLProxy
property.summary: The TLS proxy profile is deprecated. Use a TLS client profile.
property.description: <p>Specifies a TLS proxy profile for securing the communication between the DataPower Gateway and the remote Multi-Enterprise Integration Gateway server.</p>

property.name: RemoteConnectionTimeout
property.summary: Connection timeout
property.description: Specifies the number of seconds that the DataPower Gateway waits to establish a connection to the Multi-Enterprise Integration Gateway server. Enter a value in the range 1 - 86400. The default value is 60.

property.name: XMLManager
property.summary: An XML manager
property.description: Specifies an existing XML manager. An XML manager obtains and manages XML documents, stylesheets, and other document resources on behalf of one or more services.

property.name: EnablePassthrough
property.summary: Whether to pass the original AS2 requests to DataPower service processing policy
property.description: Controls whether to pass the original AS2 requests to the processing policy of DataPower service. <ul><li>When enabled, the AS2 proxy handler passes the original AS2 requests to DataPower service processing policy.</li><li>When disabled, the AS2 proxy handler first uses the cryptographic information in the partner exchange profile to decrypt the incoming AS2 requests and verify the signature. The AS2 proxy handler then passes the decrypted request body with signature removed to DataPower service for processing.</li></ul>

property.name: EnableVisibilityEvent
property.summary: Whether to send visibility events to the MEIG visibility event endpoint
property.description: Controls whether to send the visibility events generated by the AS2 proxy handler to the MEIG visibility event endpoint. These visibility events are correlated to those generated by the Multi-Enterprise Integration Gateway server in one transaction thread.

property.name: VisibilityEventEndpoint
property.summary: The location of the MEIG visibility event endpoint
property.description: Specifies the URL of the MEIG visibility event endpoint. Enter the URL in the format of static IBM MQ URL that provides the information about the IBM MQ server name, queue manager name, and name of the channel configured in the Multi-Enterprise Integration Gateway server. For example, dpmq://NAME_OF_MQ_OBJECT/?RequestQueue=QUEUE_NAME_FOR_VISIBILITY_EVENT

property.name: EnableHmacAuthentication
property.summary: Whether to use HMAC to secure visibility event delivery
property.description: Controls whether to use Hash-based Message Authentication Code (HMAC) to secure all visibility events sent to the visibility event endpoint. If HMAC is enabled in the Multi-Enterprise Integration Gateway server, you must enable HMAC authentication in the AS2 proxy handler to avoid message rejection.

property.name: HmacPassphrase
property.summary: HMAC passphrase
property.description: Specifies the passphrase used to calculate the HMAC token for message authentication and integrity check in the Multi-Enterprise Integration Gateway server.

property.name: HmacPassphraseAlias
property.summary: HMAC passphrase alias
property.description: Specifies the password alias of the passphrase used to calculate the HMAC token for message authentication and integrity checking in the Multi-Enterprise Integration Gateway server.

property.name: SSLServerConfigType
property.summary: Set the TLS profile type to secure connections between clients and the DataPower Gateway
property.description: The TLS profile type to secure connections between clients and the DataPower Gateway.

property.name: SSLServer
property.summary: Set the TLS server profile to secure connections between clients and the DataPower Gateway
property.description: The TLS server profile to secure connections between clients and the DataPower Gateway.

property.name: SSLSNIServer
property.summary: Set the TLS SNI server profile to secure connections between clients and the DataPower Gateway
property.description: The TLS SNI server profile to secure connections between clients and the DataPower Gateway.

property.name: SSLClientConfigType
property.summary: Set the TLS profile type to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and the remote Multi-Enterprise Integration Gateway server.
property.description: <p>The TLS profile type to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and the remote Multi-Enterprise Integration Gateway server. This communication must be TLS protected. You can define the TLS proxy profile for this communication in one of the following places:</p><ul><li>Define the TLS profile in the user agent that is assigned to the XML manager for the DataPower service service.</li><li>Define the TLS profile here.</li></ul><p>Ensure that the TLS profile is defined in one of these places. Without the remote TLS profile, processing is stopped and an error is logged.</p>

property.name: SSLClient
property.summary: Set the TLS client profile to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and its targets
property.description: The TLS client profile to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and its targets.

object.description: A MEIG AS2 proxy handler receives AS2 requests over HTTP or HTTPS and forwards them to the backend which is assumed to be an IBM Multi-Enterprise Integration Gateway (MEIG) server. AS2 proxy handlers conform to gateway specifications of RFC 2616 and AS2 specification of RFC 4130.
